qas.question: When was the Eritrean Railway completed in Saati?
When did the Eritrean Railway reach the Asmara highlands?
What was the longest line in the world during its time?
In what areas of public service were Eritreans particularly employed?
In what year was the Asmara-Massawa Cableway completed?
In what year did the Italo-Turkish War start?
In what year did the First Italo-Abyssinian War start?
What nationality started the Italo-Turkish war?
Where did the Eritrean Railway originate?

context: In 1888, the <b8_0>Italian<b8_0/> administration launched its first development projects in the new colony. The Eritrean Railway was completed to Saati in <a0_0><b5_0>1888<b5_0/><a0_0/>, and reached Asmara in the highlands in <a1_0><b6_0><b7_0>1911<b7_0/><b6_0/><a1_0/>. <a2_0>The Asmara–<b9_0>Massawa<b9_0/> Cableway<a2_0/> was the longest line in the world during its time, but was later dismantled by <a3_0>the British<a3_0/> in World War II. Besides major infrastructural projects, the colonial authorities invested significantly in the agricultural sector. It also oversaw the provision of urban amenities in Asmara and Massawa, and employed many Eritreans in public service, particularly in the <a4_0>police and public works departments<a4_0/>. Thousands of Eritreans were concurrently enlisted in the army, serving during the Italo-Turkish War in Libya as well as the First and second Italo-Abyssinian Wars.
